member.name: IDirectManipulationContent.GetContentRect
member.summary: Retrieves the bounding rectangle of the content, relative to the bounding rectangle of the viewport (if defined).
member.param: The bounding rectangle of the content.
member.returns: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IDirectManipulationContent.GetContentTransform

summary.code: Retrieves the transform applied to the content.

member.param: The size of the transform matrix. This value is always 6, because a 3x2 matrix is used for all direct manipulation transforms.
member.returns: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IDirectManipulationContent.GetOutputTransform
member.summary: Gets the final transform applied to the content.
member.param: The size of the transform matrix. This value is always 6, because a 3x2 matrix is used for all direct manipulation transforms.
member.returns: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IDirectManipulationContent.SyncContentTransform
member.summary: Modifies the content transform while maintaining the output transform.
member.param: The size of the transform matrix. This value is always 6, because a 3x2 matrix is used for all direct manipulation transforms.
member.returns: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Encapsulates content inside a viewport, where content represents a visual surface clipped inside the viewport.
The content has a set of transforms that controls the visual movement of the surface during manipulation and inertia.
summary.div: Note When implementing a Direct Manipulation object, ensure that the implementation supports multithreading through thread-safe reference counting. For more information, see and .
